trans-unit.source: Restore a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Restore a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to restore your web app from a backup.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to restore your web app from a backup.

trans-unit.source: Restore a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Restore a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to restore a web app that you have previously backed up by using the [App Service Web Apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) Backup feature.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to restore a web app that you have previously backed up by using the [App Service Web Apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) Backup feature.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [App Service Web Apps Backups](web-sites-backup.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [App Service Web Apps Backups](web-sites-backup.md).

trans-unit.source: The Web Apps Restore feature lets you restore your web app on-demand to a previous state, or create a new web app based on one of your original web app's backups.
trans-unit.target: The Web Apps Restore feature lets you restore your web app on-demand to a previous state, or create a new web app based on one of your original web app's backups.

trans-unit.source: Creating a new web app that runs in parallel to the latest version can be useful for A/B testing.
trans-unit.target: Creating a new web app that runs in parallel to the latest version can be useful for A/B testing.

trans-unit.source: The Web Apps Restore feature, available on the **Backups** blade in the [Azure preview portal](http://portal.azure.com), is available only in Standard and Premium modes.
trans-unit.target: The Web Apps Restore feature, available on the **Backups** blade in the [Azure preview portal](http://portal.azure.com), is available only in Standard and Premium modes.

trans-unit.source: For information about scaling your app using Standard or Premium mode, see [Scale a web app in Azure App Service](web-sites-scale.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about scaling your app using Standard or Premium mode, see [Scale a web app in Azure App Service](web-sites-scale.md).

trans-unit.source: Note that the Premium mode allows a greater number of daily backups to be performed over the Standard mode.
trans-unit.target: Note that the Premium mode allows a greater number of daily backups to be performed over the Standard mode.

trans-unit.source: To Restore a web app from a previously made backup
trans-unit.target: To Restore a web app from a previously made backup

trans-unit.source: On the **Settings** blade of your web app in the Azure portal, click the **Backups** option to display the **Backups** blade.
trans-unit.target: On the **Settings** blade of your web app in the Azure portal, click the **Backups** option to display the **Backups** blade.

trans-unit.source: Scroll in this blade and select one of the backup item based on the **BACKUP TIME** and the **STATUS** from the backup list.
trans-unit.target: Scroll in this blade and select one of the backup item based on the **BACKUP TIME** and the **STATUS** from the backup list.

trans-unit.source: ![Choose backup source][ChooseBackupSource]
trans-unit.target: ![Choose backup source][ChooseBackupSource]

trans-unit.source: Select **Restore Now** at the top of the **Backups** blade.
trans-unit.target: Select **Restore Now** at the top of the **Backups** blade.

trans-unit.source: ![Choose restore now][ChooseRestoreNow]
trans-unit.target: ![Choose restore now][ChooseRestoreNow]

trans-unit.source: In the **Restore** blade, to restore the existing web app, verify all the displayed details and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Restore** blade, to restore the existing web app, verify all the displayed details and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: You can also restore your web app to a new web app by selecting the **WEB APP** part from the **Restore** blade and selecting the **Create a new web app** part.
trans-unit.target: You can also restore your web app to a new web app by selecting the **WEB APP** part from the **Restore** blade and selecting the **Create a new web app** part.

trans-unit.source: Download or delete a backup from a storage account
trans-unit.target: Download or delete a backup from a storage account

trans-unit.source: From the main **Browse** blade of the Azure portal, select **Storage Accounts**.
trans-unit.target: From the main **Browse** blade of the Azure portal, select **Storage Accounts**.

trans-unit.source: A list of your existing storage accounts will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: A list of your existing storage accounts will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: Select the storage account that contains the backup that you want to download or delete.
trans-unit.target: Select the storage account that contains the backup that you want to download or delete.

trans-unit.source: The **STORAGE** blade will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: The **STORAGE** blade will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Containers** part in the **STORAGE** blade to display the **Containers** blade.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Containers** part in the **STORAGE** blade to display the **Containers** blade.

trans-unit.source: A list of containers will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: A list of containers will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: This list will also show the URL and the date of when this container was last modified.
trans-unit.target: This list will also show the URL and the date of when this container was last modified.

trans-unit.source: ![View Containers][ViewContainers]
trans-unit.target: ![View Containers][ViewContainers]

trans-unit.source: In the list, select the container and display the blade that shows a list of file names, along with the size of each file.
trans-unit.target: In the list, select the container and display the blade that shows a list of file names, along with the size of each file.

trans-unit.source: By selecting a file, you can either choose to **Download** or **Delete** the file.
trans-unit.target: By selecting a file, you can either choose to **Download** or **Delete** the file.

trans-unit.source: Note that there are two primary file types, .zip files and .xml files.
trans-unit.target: Note that there are two primary file types, .zip files and .xml files.

trans-unit.source: View the Audit Logs
trans-unit.target: View the Audit Logs

trans-unit.source: To see details about the success or failure of the web app restore operation, select the **Audit Log** part of the main **Browse** blade.
trans-unit.target: To see details about the success or failure of the web app restore operation, select the **Audit Log** part of the main **Browse** blade.

trans-unit.source: The **Audio log** blade displays all of your operations, along with level, status, resource, and time details.
trans-unit.target: The **Audio log** blade displays all of your operations, along with level, status, resource, and time details.

trans-unit.source: Scroll the blade to find operations related to your web app.
trans-unit.target: Scroll the blade to find operations related to your web app.

trans-unit.source: To view additional details about an operation, select the operation in the list.
trans-unit.target: To view additional details about an operation, select the operation in the list.

trans-unit.source: The details blade will display the available information related to the operation.
trans-unit.target: The details blade will display the available information related to the operation.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: What's changed
trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
